benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/tags - Remove tags from bundle

covered: DELETE Valid Deletion: Success cases for removing all tags, specific tags, empty array, very large sets; all return 204 with empty body (TC01, TC02, TC04, TC12, TC16).
Path and query validation: Invalid bundleId format -> 400 (TC05); invalid tagDef format -> 400; partial invalid tagDef -> 400 (TC07, TC13).
Non-Existent Resource: Valid UUID but missing bundle -> 404 (TC06).
Required/optional headers: Missing X-Killbill-CreatedBy -> 400; optional X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment supported (TC08, TC03).
Concurrency: 100 concurrent DELETEs with integrity checks (TC15).
Resiliency: Service unavailable -> 503; timeout handling with 504 or 204 (TC10, TC18).
Security hardening: Header injection/XSS validation (TC14); unauthorized user -> 401 (TC09).
Query param handling: multi-valued tagDef, absence of tagDef, and ignored extra params (TC01, TC02, TC11, TC16).
Integration/data consistency: Follow-up GET confirms tag state post-deletion (TC17).
gaps: Soft delete/audit expectations: No verification of soft-delete vs hard delete semantics or audit trail entries created using CreatedBy/Reason/Comment.
Idempotency: No explicit scenario for repeated DELETE calls with the same tagDef ensuring consistent 204 and no side effects beyond TC04.
Unknown-but-valid tagDef UUIDs: Behavior not covered when tagDef contains valid UUIDs not associated with the bundle (should be ignored vs error).
Atomicity on partial invalid tagDef: TC13 asserts 400 but does not verify that no valid tags were removed (rollback).
Response headers: No checks for Content-Type (produces application/json), standard error model shape, or headers like Cache-Control (if applicable for errors).
Authorization granularity: 403 Forbidden (authenticated but not permitted) not distinguished from 401 in any scenario.
Rate limiting/throttling: No coverage for 429 or server behavior under burst traffic beyond concurrency correctness.
Method/contract strictness: No test for 405 on unsupported methods for the same resource or for Accept header negotiation.
recommendations: Add an audit/soft-delete scenario: verify audit log entries created with X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment and confirm whether deletion is soft vs hard per product spec.
Add an idempotency test: perform repeated DELETEs with identical tagDef sets and verify stable 204 and no errors.
Cover unknown-but-valid tagDef UUIDs: include a case where some tagDefs are valid UUIDs but not attached to the bundle; define and assert expected behavior (ignore vs error).
Strengthen TC13 to assert transactional behavior: on 400 due to one invalid tagDef, verify that no valid tags were removed.
Validate response headers and error model: assert Content-Type: application/json on success/error, and check standard error payload fields (code, message).
Add a 403 scenario for authenticated users lacking permission to delete tags.
Introduce rate-limiting tests to validate 429 and proper Retry-After headers under burst traffic.
Add contract strictness tests: unsupported methods return 405; exercise Accept header variations to confirm content negotiation.
